segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Katherine, and we've been traveling around the world eating different foods from different countries, and today we're in Thailand.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine，我们一直在世界各地旅行，品尝不同国家的美食，今天我们在泰国。

segments.en: That's right, Thai food is one of the most popular types of food around the world, especially because of that specific Asian taste it has.
segments.cn: 没错，泰国菜是世界上最受欢迎的美食之一，尤其是因为它特有的亚洲风味。

segments.en: And so we're going to jump right into this dialogue today and see what we have prepared for you today.
segments.cn: 所以我们今天就直接进入对话，看看我们为你们准备了什么。

segments.en: What did you cook?
segments.cn: 你做了什么菜？

segments.en: Well, as you know, I was in Thailand last month, and I took a cooking class.
segments.cn: 嗯，正如你所知，我上个月在泰国，参加了一个烹饪课程。

segments.en: So I prepared some of my favorite dishes.
segments.cn: 所以我准备了一些我最喜欢的菜。

segments.en: Great idea.
segments.cn: 好主意。

segments.en: As long as I don't get food poisoning.
segments.cn: 只要我不食物中毒就好。

segments.en: So what is on the menu tonight?
segments.cn: 那今晚的菜单上有什么？

segments.en: Okay, for starters, we have tam yum soup.
segments.cn: 好吧，开胃菜是冬阴功汤。

segments.en: It's a bit spicy, but really good.
segments.cn: 有点辣，但真的很好。

segments.en: This is delicious.
segments.cn: 这太美味了。

segments.en: The ginger and lemongrass really give it a nice taste.
segments.cn: 姜和香茅真的给它增添了美味。

segments.en: Now, this next dish is one of the most famous.
segments.cn: 现在，这道菜是最著名的之一。

segments.en: Foreigners call it papaya salad, but the proper name is Tom Sam.
segments.cn: 外国人称它为木瓜沙拉，但正确的名字是泰式青木瓜沙拉。

segments.en: It is a spicy salad made from a mix of fresh vegetables, including shredded, unripened papaya, and tomato.
segments.cn: 这是一道由新鲜蔬菜混合而成的辣沙拉，包括切丝的未成熟木瓜和番茄。

segments.en: This is delicious.
segments.cn: 这太美味了。

segments.en: The combination of sour and spicy is really interesting.
segments.cn: 酸辣的组合真的很有趣。

segments.en: I could have this every day.
segments.cn: 我每天都想吃这个。

segments.en: Okay, now for the last and best dish in my opinion.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在是我认为的最后一道也是最好的一道菜。

segments.en: This is called pad Thai.
segments.cn: 这叫泰式炒河粉。

segments.en: It's stir fried noodles with eggs, fish sauce, tamarind juice, red chili pepper, plus bean sprouts, shrimp and tofu, garnished with crushed peanuts and coriander.
segments.cn: 这是用鸡蛋、鱼露、罗望子汁、红辣椒、豆芽、虾和豆腐炒的面条，最后撒上碎花生和香菜。

segments.en: It's practically Thailand's national dish.
segments.cn: 这几乎是泰国的国菜。

segments.en: Wow, this is great.
segments.cn: 哇，这太棒了。

segments.en: I never knew Thai food was so creative and delicious.
segments.cn: 我从来不知道泰国菜如此有创意和美味。

segments.en: Want some more?
segments.cn: 还想要吗？

segments.en: I'm stuffed.
segments.cn: 我吃饱了。

segments.en: Alright, so we've got a number of different dishes we'd like to talk about, as well as phrases.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有很多不同的菜想要讨论，还有一些短语。

segments.en: So let's look at some of those dishes and important keywords in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以让我们看看这些菜和重要的关键词。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: Alright, so the first word we have on language takeaway today is food poisoning.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天语言要点的第一个词是食物中毒。

segments.en: So we don't want to get food poisoning when having any meal.
segments.cn: 所以我们在用餐时不想食物中毒。

segments.en: Any meal, no, that's right.
segments.cn: 任何餐食，没错。

segments.en: Food poisoning is a bad thing.
segments.cn: 食物中毒是件坏事。

segments.en: Now this is something that happens when you eat bad food or dirty food.
segments.cn: 这通常发生在你吃了坏食物或脏食物时。

segments.en: Basically, you get very, very sick and you feel like you have to vomit.
segments.cn: 基本上，你会非常非常生病，感觉想呕吐。

segments.en: You have to throw up.
segments.cn: 你必须呕吐。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So your stomach hurts.
segments.cn: 所以你的胃会痛。

segments.en: You feel like you have to throw up.
segments.cn: 你感觉想呕吐。

segments.en: You may be going to the bathroom very often.
segments.cn: 你可能会很频繁地上厕所。

segments.en: That means usually you have food poisoning.
segments.cn: 这通常意味着你有食物中毒。

segments.en: Alright, and so people often associate food poisoning with food that you eat on the street, maybe dirtier food.
segments.cn: 好吧，人们通常将食物中毒与街头食物联系在一起，可能是更脏的食物。

segments.en: But this is something you should be very careful of when you're traveling.
segments.cn: 但这在旅行时你应该非常小心。

segments.en: Not to Thailand alone, but maybe to any other country.
segments.cn: 不仅仅是泰国，可能在任何其他国家。

segments.en: You can get it in America.
segments.cn: 你在美国也可能会得。

segments.en: You can get it in Mexico.
segments.cn: 你在墨西哥也可能会得。

segments.en: So just something to be careful of.
segments.cn: 所以这是一件需要小心的事情。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So apart from that, we're going to jump into our first dish for today.
segments.cn: 除此之外，我们将开始今天的第一道菜。

segments.en: We're having soup called Tom Yum soup.
segments.cn: 我们要吃的汤叫冬阴功汤。

segments.en: Tom Yum soup.
segments.cn: 冬阴功汤。

segments.en: Now this is one of my favorite soups.
segments.cn: 这是我最喜欢的汤之一。

segments.en: It's quite spicy, isn't it, Marco?
segments.cn: 这很辣，是吗，Marco？

segments.en: Very spicy, but very, very good as well.
segments.cn: 非常辣，但也非常好。

segments.en: It has a kind of citric taste like a lemon.
segments.cn: 它有一种柠檬的酸味。

segments.en: It does, and it's very yellow or orange colored.
segments.cn: 确实如此，而且颜色非常黄或橙。

segments.en: It's a very, very common dish on Thai restaurant menus.
segments.cn: 这是泰国餐厅菜单上非常常见的菜。

segments.en: And there are some key ingredients in this soup that I think are important to discuss.
segments.cn: 这汤里有一些关键成分，我认为值得讨论。

segments.en: They're often found in Thai food and other kinds of Asian food.
segments.cn: 它们通常出现在泰国菜和其他亚洲菜中。

segments.en: The first one is ginger.
segments.cn: 第一个是姜。

segments.en: Ginger, that's right.
segments.cn: 姜，没错。

segments.en: This is a root.
segments.cn: 这是一种根。

segments.en: It kind of looks like a potato almost.
segments.cn: 它看起来有点像土豆。

segments.en: It does.
segments.cn: 确实如此。

segments.en: It's usually white and it has little arms.
segments.cn: 通常是白色的，有小手臂。

segments.en: It's not a round object.
segments.cn: 它不是一个圆形物体。

segments.en: It's got pointy little arms.
segments.cn: 它有尖尖的小手臂。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And ginger is, the characteristic taste of ginger is kind of strong and bitter.
segments.cn: 姜的特征味道是比较强烈和苦的。

segments.en: It is quite strong.
segments.cn: 确实很强烈。

segments.en: You'll find it in Japanese food.
segments.cn: 你会在日本料理中找到它。

segments.en: Oftentimes you get pickled ginger to eat.
segments.cn: 通常你会吃到腌姜。

segments.en: It's like a pink food.
segments.cn: 它是粉红色的。

segments.en: You get it with Sushi.
segments.cn: 你在寿司时会吃到。

segments.en: Other times in like Chinese cooking, it's something that's chopped up with garlic and cooked in oil.
segments.cn: 其他时候在中国烹饪中，它是与大蒜一起切碎并用油炒的。

segments.en: So ginger is a very important one.
segments.cn: 所以姜是非常重要的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So in this soup we have ginger and we also have lemongrass.
segments.cn: 所以在这汤里我们有姜，还有香茅。

segments.en: So this is very interesting because it's not very easily found around the world.
segments.cn: 这很有趣，因为在世界各地不容易找到。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: This is very common in Southeast Asian cooking.
segments.cn: 这在东南亚烹饪中非常常见。

segments.en: And you might have a hard time finding it in places like America where it's not really a part of the cuisine.
segments.cn: 你可能在像美国这样的地方很难找到，因为它并不是当地菜的一部分。

segments.en: But lemongrass is very distinct.
segments.cn: 但香茅非常独特。

segments.en: It has a very strong flavor and it's actually quite long.
segments.cn: 它有很强的味道，而且实际上很长。

segments.en: It's green and long.
segments.cn: 它是绿色且很长。

segments.en: It looks a bit like celery, but it's harder.
segments.cn: 它看起来有点像芹菜，但更硬。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And the taste that it gives it is a little bit citric, kind of like a lemon almost.
segments.cn: 它带来的味道有点酸，几乎像柠檬。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: But you're going to find this in soups like Tom yum or other things.
segments.cn: 但你会在像冬阴功汤或其他菜中找到它。

segments.en: So lemongrass is another one.
segments.cn: 所以香茅是另一个。

segments.en: And then moving on to our next dish, which is one of the most, I think, the most popular dishes of all Thailand is the famous Pad Thai.
segments.cn: 然后我们继续到下一道菜，我认为这是泰国最受欢迎的菜之一，就是著名的泰式炒河粉。

segments.en: Pad Thai.
segments.cn: 泰式炒河粉。

segments.en: Now this is absolutely my favorite Thai dish and I know that's very cliche.
segments.cn: 这是我最喜欢的泰国菜，我知道这很老套。

segments.en: It's something that everyone says, but it's true.
segments.cn: 这是每个人都说的，但这是真的。

segments.en: You know, this is a great dish you can buy on the street.
segments.cn: 你知道，这是一道你可以在街上买到的美味菜。

segments.en: You can buy it in a restaurant.
segments.cn: 你可以在餐馆里买到。

segments.en: It's basically a noodle dish, right?
segments.cn: 基本上这是一道面条菜，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: It's a stir fried noodles with eggs and peanuts are the most like the key ingredients in there.
segments.cn: 这是一道炒面，鸡蛋和花生是其中的主要成分。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: But you might also get a little bit of hot red pepper, some sugar, some lime, and the noodles are flat.
segments.cn: 但你可能还会加一点红辣椒、一些糖、一些青柠，面条是扁的。

segments.en: They're not round.
segments.cn: 它们不是圆的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And actually one of the key ingredients also that gives it this very distinct taste is tamarind juice.
segments.cn: 其实，给它这种独特味道的关键成分之一是罗望子汁。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Tamarind juice.
segments.cn: 罗望子汁。

segments.en: This is again another one of those flavors from Southeast Asia that you might not find in many other places.
segments.cn: 这又是东南亚的一种风味，你可能在其他地方找不到。

segments.en: Certainly not in America.
segments.cn: 在美国肯定找不到。

segments.en: Now tamarind, they're funny looking things.
segments.cn: 现在罗望子，它们看起来很奇怪。

segments.en: They look like peas, but they're dark brown.
segments.cn: 它们看起来像豌豆，但是深棕色的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So tamarind juice gives it this kind of sweet flavor.
segments.cn: 所以罗望子汁给它带来了这种甜味。

segments.en: So this is the interesting thing about Pad Thai is that you have these sweet flavors from the tamarind juice, from even the fish sauce combined with chili.
segments.cn: 所以泰式炒河粉有趣的地方在于，你有来自罗望子汁的甜味，甚至还有鱼露与辣椒的结合。

segments.en: So it's kind of like a spicy, very sweet taste.
segments.cn: 所以它有点像辛辣又非常甜的味道。

segments.en: And then you have citrus.
segments.cn: 然后你还有柑橘味。

segments.en: You have some lime maybe and some sugar.
segments.cn: 你可能有一些青柠和一些糖。

segments.en: So it's a lot of different tastes and flavors, but it's a really magical combination.
segments.cn: 所以有很多不同的味道和风味，但这真的是一种神奇的组合。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So that's all we have for language takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以这就是我们语言学习的内容。

segments.en: Why don't we take another listen to our dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们再听一遍对话吧。

segments.en: What did you cook?
segments.cn: 你做了什么？

segments.en: Well, as you know, I was in Thailand last month and I took a cooking class.
segments.cn: 嗯，正如你所知，我上个月在泰国，参加了一个烹饪课程。

segments.en: So I prepared some of my favorite dishes.
segments.cn: 所以我准备了一些我最喜欢的菜。

segments.en: Great idea.
segments.cn: 好主意。

segments.en: As long as I don't get food poisoning.
segments.cn: 只要我不食物中毒就好。

segments.en: So what is on the menu tonight?
segments.cn: 那今晚的菜单上有什么？

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: For starters, we have Tom yum soup.
segments.cn: 开胃菜是冬阴功汤。

segments.en: It's a bit spicy, but really good.
segments.cn: 有点辣，但真的很好。

segments.en: This is delicious.
segments.cn: 这真好吃。

segments.en: The ginger and lemongrass really give it a nice taste.
segments.cn: 姜和香茅真的给它增添了美味。

segments.en: Now this next dish is one of the most famous.
segments.cn: 现在下一个菜是最著名的之一。

segments.en: Foreigners call it papaya salad, but the proper name is Tom Sam.
segments.cn: 外国人称它为木瓜沙拉，但正式名称是泰式青木瓜沙拉。

segments.en: It is a spicy salad made from a mix of fresh vegetables, including shredded, unripened papaya and tomato.
segments.cn: 这是一道用新鲜蔬菜混合而成的辣沙拉，包括切丝的未成熟木瓜和番茄。

segments.en: This is delicious.
segments.cn: 这真好吃。

segments.en: The combination of sour and spicy is really interesting.
segments.cn: 酸和辣的结合真的很有趣。

segments.en: I could have this every day.
segments.cn: 我每天都可以吃这个。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Now for the last and best dish in my opinion.
segments.cn: 现在是我认为的最后一道也是最好的一道菜。

segments.en: This is called pad Thai.
segments.cn: 这叫泰式炒河粉。

segments.en: It's stir fried noodles with eggs, fish sauce, tamarind juice, red chili pepper, plus bean sprouts, shrimp and tofu.
segments.cn: 这是炒面，配有鸡蛋、鱼露、罗望子汁、红辣椒，加上豆芽、虾和豆腐。

segments.en: Garnished with crushed peanuts and coriander.
segments.cn: 上面撒有碎花生和香菜。

segments.en: It's practically Thailand's national dish.
segments.cn: 这几乎是泰国的国菜。

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: This is great.
segments.cn: 这太棒了。

segments.en: I never knew Thai food was so creative and delicious.
segments.cn: 我从来不知道泰国菜如此有创意和美味。

segments.en: Want some more?
segments.cn: 还想要吗？

segments.en: I'm stuffed.
segments.cn: 我吃饱了。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at four key phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利表达的四个关键短语。

segments.en: So first up, we have the phrase on the menu.
segments.cn: 首先，我们有菜单上的短语。

segments.en: What's on the menu tonight?
segments.cn: 今晚菜单上有什么？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: That person asked, so what's on the menu?
segments.cn: 那个人问，菜单上有什么？

segments.en: And by saying this, we're saying, well, what are we having for dinner?
segments.cn: 通过这样说，我们在问，晚餐吃什么？

segments.en: What are we going to eat?
segments.cn: 我们要吃什么？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you might want to think, okay, menu, I'm going to look at the menu.
segments.cn: 所以你可能会想，好的，菜单，我要看看菜单。

segments.en: But you could even say this at home where there is no menu.
segments.cn: 但你甚至可以在家里说这个，即使没有菜单。

segments.en: This is a spoken language way of saying, what are we eating tonight?
segments.cn: 这是一种口语表达，意思是，今晚我们吃什么？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: What's for dinner?
segments.cn: 晚餐吃什么？

segments.en: What are we eating?
segments.cn: 我们要吃什么？

segments.en: What's on the menu?
segments.cn: 菜单上有什么？

segments.en: Even though, as you said, there's no menu.
segments.cn: 即使，正如你所说，没有菜单。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And after that, we have another phrase that's really important.
segments.cn: 然后我们有另一个非常重要的短语。

segments.en: We say, for starters, we're going to have this or that.
segments.cn: 我们说，开胃菜，我们要吃这个或那个。

segments.en: So for starters.
segments.cn: 所以开胃菜。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We said for starters, we are having a soup, a Tom Yum soup.
segments.cn: 我们说开胃菜，我们要吃汤，冬阴功汤。

segments.en: So a starter dish is something that you have to begin the meal, a small dish, maybe.
segments.cn: 所以开胃菜是一道你用来开始用餐的小菜。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Start, starter.
segments.cn: 开始，开胃菜。

segments.en: So a starter is a noun, it's a thing, and it's something you eat at the beginning.
segments.cn: 所以开胃菜是名词，是一种东西，是你在开始时吃的东西。

segments.en: Usually, it's not very heavy.
segments.cn: 通常，它不是很重。

segments.en: A steak would never be a starter, right?
segments.cn: 牛排绝对不会是开胃菜，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So here, we have Tom Yum soup, which is our starter.
segments.cn: 所以这里，我们有冬阴功汤，作为我们的开胃菜。

segments.en: And after that, we have the national dish.
segments.cn: 然后我们有国菜。

segments.en: Now, this is a great phrase.
segments.cn: 现在，这是一个很好的短语。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: We have the Pad Thai, which is considered to be the national dish.
segments.cn: 我们有泰式炒河粉，被认为是国菜。

segments.en: And so, usually, every country has their national dish.
segments.cn: 所以，通常每个国家都有他们的国菜。

segments.en: Something that's unique or that a country is famous for.
segments.cn: 一些独特的或一个国家以此而闻名的东西。

segments.en: Like, for example, China would be famous for...
segments.cn: 比如，中国以...

segments.en: Kung Pao chicken.
segments.cn: 宫保鸡丁而闻名。

segments.en: Kung Pao chicken, yeah.
segments.cn: 宫保鸡丁，是的。

segments.en: In America, you might even say that apple pie is the most, you know, important national dish.
segments.cn: 在美国，你甚至可以说苹果派是最重要的国菜。

segments.en: But do you guys have one in Ecuador?
segments.cn: 但你们在厄瓜多尔有吗？

segments.en: What's your national dish?
segments.cn: 你们的国菜是什么？

segments.en: I would say I have no idea which would be.
segments.cn: 我想我不知道是什么。

segments.en: It's very not very well known.
segments.cn: 这并不是很出名。

segments.en: Maybe ceviche is kind of shared between Peru and Ecuador.
segments.cn: 也许生鱼片在秘鲁和厄瓜多尔之间共享。

segments.en: Like, maybe in Argentina, you would say steak is a national dish.
segments.cn: 比如，在阿根廷，你可以说牛排是国菜。

segments.en: Yeah, absolutely.
segments.cn: 是的，绝对是。

segments.en: Or in Mexico, you know, like tacos or enchiladas, stuff like that.
segments.cn: 或在墨西哥，你知道的，比如玉米饼或墨西哥卷饼，类似的东西。

segments.en: Or in Italy, spaghetti bolognese.
segments.cn: 或在意大利，意大利肉酱面。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So we have a number of different countries, and each country maybe has one or two national dishes.
segments.cn: 所以我们有很多不同的国家，每个国家可能有一到两个国菜。

segments.en: These are very special dishes that are important for that country.
segments.cn: 这些是对那个国家非常重要的特殊菜肴。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we have our national dishes, and after we finish dinner, we ate so much that we say, I'm stuffed.
segments.cn: 所以我们有我们的国菜，吃完晚餐后，我们吃得太多了，以至于说，我吃饱了。

segments.en: I'm stuffed.
segments.cn: 我吃饱了。

segments.en: Now, this is a common phrase that you will hear at the end of a meal when you've eaten and eaten and eaten, and it just means I'm full.
segments.cn: 现在，这是你在一顿饭结束时会听到的常用短语，当你吃了很多，意思就是我吃饱了。

segments.en: I'm full.
segments.cn: 我吃饱了。

segments.en: I can't eat anymore.
segments.cn: 我不能再吃了。

segments.en: Yeah, I'm stuffed.
segments.cn: 是的，我吃饱了。

segments.en: So stuffed means that I'm full of things.
segments.cn: 所以“吃饱了”意味着我吃了很多东西。

segments.en: Now, it's a very informal way of saying I'm full, right?
segments.cn: 现在，这是一种非常非正式的说法，表示我吃饱了，对吧？

segments.en: Because if somebody says, would you like some more soup, you say, no thank you, I'm full.
segments.cn: 因为如果有人问，你想再来点汤吗，你会说，不，谢谢，我吃饱了。

segments.en: Right, but if you're with friends, you can say, ugh, I just had so much pizza, I'm stuffed.
segments.cn: 对，但如果你和朋友在一起，你可以说，呃，我刚吃了太多比萨，我吃饱了。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So it's a little bit more informal, but a lot more native-like.
segments.cn: 所以这有点非正式，但更像本地人。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: All right, so let's take a listen to our dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 好的，所以让我们最后再听一遍我们的对话。

segments.en: What did you cook?
segments.cn: 你做了什么？

segments.en: Well, as you know, I was in Thailand last month, and I took a cooking class.
segments.cn: 嗯，正如你所知，我上个月在泰国，我上了一堂烹饪课。

segments.en: So, I prepared some of my favorite dishes.
segments.cn: 所以，我准备了一些我最喜欢的菜肴。

segments.en: Great idea.
segments.cn: 好主意。

segments.en: As long as I don't get food poisoning.
segments.cn: 只要我不食物中毒就好。

segments.en: So, what is on the menu tonight?
segments.cn: 那么，今晚的菜单上有什么？

segments.en: Okay, for starters, we have Tom yum soup.
segments.cn: 好吧，开胃菜是冬阴功汤。

segments.en: It's a bit spicy, but really good.
segments.cn: 有点辣，但真的很好。

segments.en: This is delicious.
segments.cn: 这太美味了。

segments.en: The ginger and lemongrass really give it a nice taste.
segments.cn: 姜和香茅真的给它增添了美味。

segments.en: Now, this next dish is one of the most famous.
segments.cn: 现在，这道菜是最著名的之一。

segments.en: Foreigners call it papaya salad, but the proper name is Tom Sam.
segments.cn: 外国人称之为木瓜沙拉，但正确的名称是泰式木瓜沙拉。

segments.en: It is a spicy salad made from a mix of fresh vegetables, including shredded, unripened papaya and tomato.
segments.cn: 这是一道由新鲜蔬菜混合而成的辣沙拉，包括切丝的未成熟木瓜和番茄。

segments.en: This is delicious.
segments.cn: 这太美味了。

segments.en: The combination of sour and spicy is really interesting.
segments.cn: 酸辣的组合真的很有趣。

segments.en: I could have this every day.
segments.cn: 我每天都可以吃这个。

segments.en: Okay, now for the last and best dish in my opinion.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在是我认为的最后一道也是最好的一道菜。

segments.en: This is called Pad Thai.
segments.cn: 这叫泰式炒河粉。

segments.en: It's stir fried noodles with eggs, fish sauce, tamarind juice, red chili pepper, plus bean sprouts, shrimp and tofu.
segments.cn: 这是炒面条，配有鸡蛋、鱼露、罗望子汁、红辣椒，还有豆芽、虾和豆腐。

segments.en: Garnished with crushed peanuts and coriander.
segments.cn: 撒上碎花生和香菜。

segments.en: It's practically Thailand's national dish.
segments.cn: 这几乎是泰国的国菜。

segments.en: Wow, this is great.
segments.cn: 哇，这太棒了。

segments.en: I never knew Thai food was so creative and delicious.
segments.cn: 我从来不知道泰国食物如此有创意和美味。

segments.en: Want some more?
segments.cn: 还想要吗？

segments.en: I'm stuffed.
segments.cn: 我吃饱了。

segments.en: Alright, so speaking of Thai food, it's very famous around the world, but it's very spicy.
segments.cn: 好吧，说到泰国食物，它在世界各地都很有名，但它非常辣。

segments.en: It can be very spicy, and what always surprises me about Thai food is that the salads might be the spiciest things on the menu.
segments.cn: 它可能非常辣，而我总是对泰国食物感到惊讶的是，沙拉可能是菜单上最辣的东西。

segments.en: You know, people like to eat many different salads.
segments.cn: 你知道，人们喜欢吃很多不同的沙拉。

segments.en: You have like a chiang mai chicken salad or you have a papaya salad.
segments.cn: 你有像清迈鸡沙拉或木瓜沙拉。

segments.en: But these are really, really spicy.
segments.cn: 但这些真的非常非常辣。

segments.en: Yeah, that's right.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: We saw in our dialogue that we're eating papaya salad.
segments.cn: 我们在对话中看到我们在吃木瓜沙拉。

segments.en: And it's very interesting because it has this fruit, like papaya, and it has some other vegetables as well.
segments.cn: 这很有趣，因为它有这种水果，比如木瓜，还有一些其他蔬菜。

segments.en: But the salad is very, very spicy itself.
segments.cn: 但沙拉本身非常非常辣。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And you would never think of a fruit salad as being something that's spicy in America.
segments.cn: 你在美国永远不会想到水果沙拉是辣的。

segments.en: You'd think of it as being pretty tame, pretty boring.
segments.cn: 你会认为它相当温和，相当无聊。

segments.en: But that's the kind of what gives it a certain attraction to it, right?
segments.cn: 但这正是它吸引人的地方，对吧？

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对是。

segments.en: And I don't know if you're a big fan of Thai food.
segments.cn: 我不知道你是否是泰国食物的忠实粉丝。

segments.en: I certainly am.
segments.cn: 我当然是。

segments.en: I really like that about Thai food that you can have these really spicy dishes.
segments.cn: 我真的很喜欢泰国食物的这一点，你可以吃到这些非常辣的菜肴。

segments.en: But there's just so much flavor.
segments.cn: 但味道非常丰富。

segments.en: There's so many things happening.
segments.cn: 有很多东西在发生。

segments.en: Lemongrass, sugar, lime, fish sauce.
segments.cn: 香茅、糖、青柠、鱼露。

segments.en: Yeah, it's very, very good.
segments.cn: 是的，非常好。

segments.en: And speaking of national dishes, this is actually a very interesting question because, as we mentioned, a couple of countries have national dishes like Italy and different places.
segments.cn: 说到国菜，这实际上是一个非常有趣的问题，因为，正如我们提到的，几个国家有国菜，比如意大利和不同的地方。

segments.en: But what about in your country?
segments.cn: 但在你的国家呢？

segments.en: Do you have a national dish?
segments.cn: 你有国菜吗？

segments.en: Or what would you consider to be your national dish?
segments.cn: 或者你认为什么是你的国菜？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we'd love to hear from you guys.
segments.cn: 所以我们很想听听你们的意见。

segments.en: What's your national dish?
segments.cn: 你们的国菜是什么？

segments.en: Tell us all about it, what it tastes like.
segments.cn: 告诉我们所有关于它的事情，味道如何。

segments.en: And even if there's some history, tell us about that too.
segments.cn: 甚至如果有一些历史，也告诉我们。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: We'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
